label: axiom-domain-regularity
title: (Axiom EG-0): Regularity of the Domain
nl_summary: The single-walker state space \(\mathcal{X}\) satisfies standard regularity conditions to ensure the validity of the construction.

implications.text: The construction is valid under these conditions.

parameters.name: single-walker state space
parameters.description: The state space on which standard regularity conditions are imposed for the construction to be valid.

label: axiom-lipschitz-fields
title: (Axiom EG-1): Lipschitz Regularity of Environmental Fields
nl_summary: The force field F and steady flow field u are Lipschitz continuous on the compact valid domain X_valid, with finite Lipschitz constants L_F and L_u, ensuring local smoothness and global well-behavedness of the environmental fields.

core_statement.text: The deterministic fields F and u are locally smooth and globally well-behaved on the compact valid domain X_valid, with finite constants L_F and L_u such that for all x1, x2 in X_valid: ||F(x1) - F(x2)|| <= L_F ||x1 - x2|| and ||u(x1) - u(x2)|| <= L_u ||x1 - x2||.
core_statement.latex: There exist finite constants $L_F$ and $L_u$ such that for all $x_1, x_2 \in \mathcal{X}_{\mathrm{valid}}$: \|F(x_1) - F(x_2)\| \leq L_F \|x_1 - x_2\| and \|u(x_1) - u(x_2)\| \leq L_u \|x_1 - x_2\|.

hypotheses.text: For all x1, x2 in the compact valid domain X_valid.

implications.text: The force field satisfies ||F(x1) - F(x2)|| <= L_F ||x1 - x2||.
The steady flow field satisfies ||u(x1) - u(x2)|| <= L_u ||x1 - x2||.

parameters.name: Lipschitz constant for force field
parameters.description: Finite constant ensuring the Lipschitz continuity of the force field F

parameters.name: Lipschitz constant for steady flow field
parameters.description: Finite constant ensuring the Lipschitz continuity of the steady flow field u

parameters.name: Valid domain
parameters.description: Compact domain on which the fields are defined and well-behaved

parameters.name: Force field
parameters.description: Deterministic field governing the system's kinetic dynamics

parameters.name: Steady flow field
parameters.description: Deterministic field representing steady flow in the environment

failure_modes.description: Fields F or u are not Lipschitz continuous (e.g., discontinuous or excessively steep gradients).
failure_modes.impact: Leads to unstable kinetic dynamics, potential non-uniqueness in solutions, or unpredictable swarm behavior in the state space.

label: axiom-safe-harbor
title: (Axiom EG-2): Existence of a Safe Harbor
nl_summary: Asserts the existence of a compact safe harbor set within the valid state space, buffered from boundaries, where positional rewards strictly exceed those outside, providing a stable high-reward region.

core_statement.text: There exists a compact set C_safe subset of X_valid and a reward threshold R_safe such that the set is strictly interior and rewards inside exceed those outside.
core_statement.latex: There exists a compact set $C_{\mathrm{safe}} \subset \mathcal{X}_{\mathrm{valid}}$ and a reward threshold $R_{\mathrm{safe}}$ such that:

implications.text: C_safe lies strictly inside the valid domain with a positive safety margin.
Positional reward is strictly better inside the safe harbor.
implications.latex: $\max_{y \in C_{\mathrm{safe}}} R_{\mathrm{pos}}(y) \geq R_{\mathrm{safe}}$ and $R_{\mathrm{pos}}(x) < R_{\mathrm{safe}}$ for all $x \notin C_{\mathrm{safe}}$.

parameters.name: Safe Harbor Set
parameters.description: Compact set strictly inside the valid domain serving as a high-reward safe region.

parameters.name: Safe Reward Threshold
parameters.description: Threshold value for reward distinguishing the safe harbor from outside regions.

parameters.name: Safety Margin
parameters.description: Positive minimum distance from points in the safe set to the boundary of the valid domain.

failure_modes.description: No compact safe harbor exists in the valid domain.
failure_modes.impact: The RL agent lacks a buffered high-reward goal, increasing risk of approaching invalid boundaries or failing to achieve stable valid behaviors.

label: axiom-non-deceptive-landscape
title: (Axiom EG-3): Non-Deceptive Landscape
nl_summary: The reward landscape is non-deceptive: positions separated by at least L_grad yield rewards differing by at least kappa_raw_r > 0.

core_statement.text: There exist constants L_grad > 0 and κ_raw,r > 0 such that if ||x - y|| ≥ L_grad, then |R_pos(y) - R_pos(x)| ≥ κ_raw,r.
core_statement.latex: there exist constants $L_{\text{grad}} > 0$ and $\kappa_{\text{raw},r} > 0$ such that: If $\Vert x - y \Vert \geq L_{\text{grad}}$, then $|R_{\mathrm{pos}}(y) - R_{\mathrm{pos}}(x)| \geq \kappa_{\text{raw},r}$.

hypotheses.text: ||x - y|| ≥ L_grad (for positions x, y of walkers)

parameters.name: L_grad
parameters.description: positive constant representing the minimal geometric separation threshold

parameters.name: kappa_raw_r
parameters.description: positive constant representing the minimal non-zero reward difference

failure_modes.description: Deceptive landscape with distant positions having arbitrarily small reward differences
failure_modes.impact: Swarm algorithms fail to distinguish configurations, causing stagnation in exploration

failure_modes.description: Vanishing gradients or flat regions beyond L_grad
failure_modes.impact: Prevents convergence to optimal swarm behaviors

label: axiom-velocity-regularization
title: (Axiom EG-4): Velocity Regularization via Reward
nl_summary: The total reward function incorporates a quadratic penalty on velocity to bound kinetic energy, ensuring stability by preferentially eliminating high-velocity walkers during cloning and enabling dissipation in the kinetic stage.

core_statement.text: The total reward function R_total(x, v) := R_pos(x) - c_v_reg ||v||^2 where c_v_reg > 0.

hypotheses.text: c_v_reg is a strictly positive constant.

implications.text: During cloning, high-velocity walkers receive low rewards and are preferentially replaced, bounding the expansion of velocity variance V_Var,v.
Prevents excessive kinetic energy growth, allowing the kinetic stage's Langevin friction to dominate and achieve net contraction of the Lyapunov function.

parameters.name: velocity regularization coefficient
parameters.description: Strictly positive constant scaling the quadratic penalty on velocity in the total reward function.

parameters.name: positional reward function
parameters.description: Reward component depending only on position x, integrated into the total reward.

parameters.name: squared velocity norm
parameters.description: Quadratic term representing kinetic energy, penalized in the reward.

failure_modes.description: If c_v_reg ≤ 0, no velocity penalization occurs.
failure_modes.impact: Uncontrolled velocity variance expansion from cloning, leading to swarm instability and failure of dissipation.

failure_modes.description: If c_v_reg is too small relative to positional rewards, penalization is insufficient.
failure_modes.impact: High velocities persist, overwhelming kinetic dissipation and preventing Lyapunov convergence.

label: axiom-active-diversity
title: (Axiom EG-5): Active Diversity Signal
nl_summary: The diversity channel of the fitness potential is active, requiring the dynamics weight β to be strictly positive.

core_statement.text: The dynamics weight β is strictly positive

parameters.name: dynamics weight
parameters.description: Weight for the diversity channel in the fitness potential.
